Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the web application, including expected traffic, scalability needs, and integration with other Azure services.
Design the architecture for the web application, including the App Service Plan, deployment slots, and integration with databases or APIs.
Set up an App Service Plan with the appropriate pricing tier and region to meet the application's performance and scalability requirements.
Deploy the web application to Azure App Service using deployment methods such as Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or manual deployment.
Set up a custom domain for the web application and configure SSL/TLS certificates for secure communication.
Integrate Application Insights to monitor the performance and usage of the web application.
Enable HTTPS-only traffic, configure authentication and authorization, and apply other security best practices for the web application.
Configure backup and restore options for the web application to ensure data resiliency.
Set up autoscaling rules to handle varying traffic loads and ensure high availability.
Perform end-to-end testing of the web application to ensure it meets functional and non-functional requirements.
Configure monitoring and alerting for the web application using Azure Monitor and Application Insights.
Document the architecture, configurations, and deployment processes for the web application.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Azure App Service setup.
Conduct periodic security audits to ensure the web application remains secure and compliant with organizational policies.
Regularly review the performance of the web application and optimize configurations as needed.
Use Azure Monitor and Application Insights to continuously monitor the performance of web applications hosted on Azure App Service. Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks.
Verify the security settings of the web application, including HTTPS enforcement, TLS versions, and custom domain bindings. Ensure compliance with organizational security policies.
Regularly update the application frameworks and runtime versions used by the web application to ensure compatibility and security.
Review and update access controls, including role-based access control (RBAC) and identity management settings, to ensure only authorized users have access.
Conduct failover tests to ensure the web application can recover quickly in case of regional outages or service disruptions.
Ensure the underlying infrastructure, including the App Service plan, is patched and updated to the latest versions to mitigate vulnerabilities.
Analyze application logs for errors, warnings, and unusual activity. Use Azure Log Analytics for deeper insights and troubleshooting.
Perform regular penetration tests to identify vulnerabilities in the web application and its hosting environment.
Evaluate the SLA performance of Azure App Service to ensure compliance with agreed metrics. Address any deviations or concerns.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding the web application's performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
